ussr.physics.jme
Class JMESimulation

java.lang.Object
  com.jme.app.AbstractGame
      ussr.physics.jme.JMEBasicGraphicalSimulation
          ussr.physics.jme.JMESimulation
All Implemented Interfaces:
PhysicsSimulation
public class JMESimulation
extends JMEBasicGraphicalSimulation
implements PhysicsSimulation

The physical simulation: initialization and main loop, references to all simulated entities.

Author:
Modular Robots @ MMMI

start

public final void start()
Description copied from class: com.jme.app.AbstractGame
start begins the game. The game is initialized by calling first initSystem then initGame. Assuming no errors were encountered during initialization, the main game loop is entered. How the loop operates is implementation-dependent. After the game loop is broken out of via a call to finish, cleanup is called. Subclasses should declare this method final.

Specified by:
start in interface PhysicsSimulation
Specified by:
start in class com.jme.app.AbstractGame

setGravity

public void setGravity(float g)
Description copied from interface: PhysicsSimulation
Directly set the gravity being used in the simulation. The preferred way of setting the gravity for a simulation is to use PhysicsParameters.setGravity(float)

waitForPhysicsStep

public void waitForPhysicsStep(boolean notify)
Description copied from interface: PhysicsSimulation
Wait for the physics step to complete by blocking the thread. If notification is requested, all other threads waiting on the simulation object are notified (awakened)

Specified by:
waitForPhysicsStep in interface PhysicsSimulation
Parameters:
notify - whether to notify other threads or not

subscribePhysicsTimestep

public void subscribePhysicsTimestep(PhysicsObserver observer)
Description copied from interface: PhysicsSimulation
Subscribe to the simulation steps, meaning that the observer is notified each time a physics step has been simulated (e.g., at the end of the physics step)

Specified by:
subscribePhysicsTimestep in interface PhysicsSimulation
Parameters:
observer - the observer to register for future events
See Also:
